title.rendered: Allen’s world record of 16 sixes against Pakistan

content.rendered:
Fin Allen’s batting innings againAFP

Zaman Khan’s slower delivery was an off cutter. He wanted to fly through mid wicket with a cross bat. Ball-bat did not hit properly, bold….

Finn Allen couldn’t get this one shot right at University Oval in Dunedin. In his previous 61-ball spell, the Kiwi opener hit the world record of sixes in an innings in T20Is. Allen hit 16 sixes in the third T20 of the series against Pakistan today, playing a 62-ball 137-run innings.

The record for the most sixes in an innings in T20 International was held by Hazratullah Zazai so far. The Afghanistan opener hit 16 sixes en route to a 162-run innings against Ireland in Dehradun in 2019.

Allen’s 137 is also New Zealand’s individual highest innings in T20 Internationals. The Kiwi opener broke Brendon McCullum’s record. McCullum scored 123 off 58 balls against Bangladesh at Pallekele in the 2012 T20 World Cup.

Finn Allen reached three figures in 48 ballsAFP

Allen’s innings is the fifth highest in 20-over international cricket and the highest against Pakistan. The previous highest was also by a Kiwi batsman against Pakistan. Mark Chapman was unbeaten on 104 off 52 balls in Rawalpindi last April.Read moreWilliamson’s series ends against Pakistan

Allen touched three figures in 48 balls before being dismissed in the 18th over. This is the third fastest for a New Zealander. Glenn Phillips scored a 46-ball century and Colin Munro scored a 47-ball century. Both at Mt Manganui, against the West Indies. Phillips in 2020, Monroe in 2018.

Haris Rauf suffered the most from Allen’s 16 sixes today. Pakistan’s right-arm pacer hit 6 sixes, including 3 in the sixth over. Rauf gave a total of 28 runs in that over.
